item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, April 3, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Overengineered Anchor Links (132 points | 59 comments)
2. A special build of curl that can impersonate Chrome and Firefox (39 points | 9 comments)
3. InitWare, a portable systemd fork running on BSDs and Linux (90 points | 27 comments)
4. I maintain a 17 year old ThinkPad (479 points | 427 comments)
5. Show HN: Novanode, Global load balancing with Caddy, no vendor lock-in (45 points | 20 comments)
6. Onyx (YC W24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
7. Show HN: Offline JavaScript PubSub between browser tabs (39 points | 13 comments)
8. An AlphaStation's SROM (45 points | 1 comment)
9. Show HN: OpenNutrition – A free, public nutrition database (219 points | 113 comments)
10. Bedded Bugs and Stung Beetles: The Cameraman's Revenge (1912) (14 points | 1 comment)
11. Show HN: The C3 programming language (C alternative language) (43 points | 11 comments)
12. Show HN: Zxc – Rust TLS proxy with tmux and Vim as UI, BurpSuite alternative (53 points | 11 comments)
13. Show HN: Benchi – A benchmarking tool written in Go (15 points | discuss)
14. Web Server for AoE 1, 2 and 3 DE supporting LAN multiplayer 100% offline (392 points | 79 comments)
15. John Cage recital set to last 639 years recently witnessed a chord change (71 points | 102 comments)
16. An open source, self-hosted implementation of the Tailscale control server (271 points | 66 comments)
17. The Steam Deck is software-freedom friendly (185 points | 178 comments)
18. Pico.sh – SSH powered services for developers (533 points | 111 comments)
19. Minimal CSS-only blurry image placeholders (386 points | 59 comments)
20. Dijkstra On the foolishness of "natural language programming" (285 points | 177 comments)
21. AnimeJs v4 Is Here (60 points | 8 comments)
22. US Administration announces 34% tariffs on China, 20% on EU (1488 points | 2725 comments)
23. Why I don't discuss politics with friends (392 points | 723 comments)
24. AI/Math Puzzle (37 points | 17 comments)
25. Animals Made from 13 Circles (2016) (601 points | 105 comments)
26. MIT 6.5950 Secure Hardware Design – An open-source course on hardware attacks (213 points | 12 comments)
27. Apple's Cubify Anything: Scaling Indoor 3D Object Detection (168 points | 21 comments)
28. Tell HN: Announcing tomhow as a public moderator (1733 points | 450 comments)
29. Flame – BBS and MUD (45 points | 12 comments)
30. Multi-Token Attention (131 points | 35 comments)
